utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. So you guys ready to order?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Since we come in every Tuesday night at six o’clock and order the same exact thing, and it’s now six oh eight, I believe your question not only answers itself but also stands alongside such other nonsensical queries as who let the dogs out? and, uh, How are they hanging?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. So, the usual, with extra spit on Sheldon’s hamburger.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny, a moment? Do you have plans this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, Amy, I’m sorry, I’m actually pretty busy this weekend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Probably serving food that was ordered today.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s too bad. I was hoping you could be my plus-one at the Institute of Interdisciplinary Studies’ symposium on the impact of current scientific research on societal interactions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s an annual science conference. We’ve all been invited to speak.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, okay, well, you know, like I said, I have plans, so.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Shame. Since you’re my best friend, I thought it would be a good bonding opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m your best friend?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t you read my blog?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, don’t feel bad. I never read Leonard’s, and I used to sleep with him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you know anybody else who would appreciate an all-expense-paid spa weekend at a four-star resort in Big Sur?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I really, I’m sorry, free what? Sorry, what, what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think her weekend just opened up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, wait, just to be clear, when you guys say spa, does that mean the same thing as when regular people say it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Pretty much. Except we keep our shirts on in the sauna.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, it is going to be difficult, but I’m going to cancel my plans so I can do this for my bestie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Please don’t touch my breasts.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I, I wasn’t going to.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right. I just want to establish boundaries.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Boy, this is great. I haven’t had a vacation in ages.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In order to take a vacation, one first has to work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, for a smart guy, you really seem to have a hard time grasping the concept, don’t piss off the people who handle the things you eat.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That does seem to be a valid principle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I trust Penny will adhere to the Official California Restaurant Workers’ Solemn Oath of Ethics and Cleanliness.”

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t believe there’s any such thing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You lied to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good morning. If I could have everyone’s attention, please? I know we’re all eager to get on the road to Big Sur, so if we focus, I’m sure we can get through this orientation in under a half an hour. Then it’s just Q_A, quiz, safety drills, pose for commemorative group photo and we’re off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t worry. Just sit next to me during the quiz, and you can copy my answers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj? What are you doing? I don’t think so. You’ve had your allotted six ounces. The first bathroom break isn’t until the Denny’s located near Bakersfield, which is approximately two and half hours away. Remember, people, we’re only as strong as our weakest bladder.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: Nobody cares about your Kegel exercises.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. We have seven people, and two cars. In the lead car, driven by Leonard, will be myself, Amy Farrah Fowler and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes! He had you in the other car, but I got you upgraded.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She made the case that if we break down in the middle of nowhere, your Nebraska backwoods skills and brawny hands will give us the best chance to survive in the wild.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Brawny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re bigger than mine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Howard, you promised.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Fine. Red Five to Red Leader. What do you want now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s eleven fifteen. I’m requesting your quarter-hourly location update.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Still right behind you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Copy that, Red Five. Radio contact is sufficient. No need to extend your middle finger.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, Amy, I’ve been wondering, are you and Sheldon going to be sharing a room?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, we discussed it. We decided we didn’t want to jeopardize our relationship by getting to know each other too well.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Indeed. Nothing sours a friendship more than over-familiarity with someone’s toilet routine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can vouch for that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not you, him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Although yours was an eye-opener.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Penny. You’re my plus-one. You’ll bunk with me. And FYI, travel makes me constipated, so I’m the ideal hotel roommate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Terrific. Are we there yet?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I hope we get there in time to see the keynote address.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? You want to see the keynote?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, it sounds fun. Super bacteria: global apocalypse or exciting research opportunity?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking we could go straight to the room and take a nap.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? And miss the keynote?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We can watch it later on C-SPAN. Besides, I was really looking forward to you and me napping together in the hotel.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well honey, if you’re that tired, why don’t you just take a nap here in the car?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, see, it’s not…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hang on. It’s Leonard. Hi, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (voice)
utterance.content: Yeah, hi. Listen, I just got a text from Raj. He wanted me to tell you that when Howard says nap, he means sex.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you an element in the actinoid series?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Amy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you usually radioactive when found in nature?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you in the lanthanoid series?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, it’s Penny’s turn. Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know. Are you food?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not apropos. We’ve already established I’m found in the periodic table.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it’s a table, right? I mean, why can’t there be food on it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I knew she wasn’t lead car material.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who elected you Road Trip God?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was a late-night vote. We were all exhausted, and he was threatening to filibuster. It’s not technically Road Trip God, it’s Travel Supervisor.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Although Road Trip God does have a certain ring to it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t understand why you people just let him bully you like this. Someone should stand up to him. What’s he going to do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe you let him kick me out of the car.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What could we do? He’s the Travel Supervisor.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Penny. This is a better car anyway.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s the Love Car.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Should I ask?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (singing)
utterance.content: They say we’re young and we don’t know, we won’t find out until we grow.

utterance.speaker: Howard (singing)
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know if all that’s true, ’cause you got me, and, baby, I got you.

utterance.speaker: Together (singing)
utterance.content: Babe, mm da-da, da-da, da-da, I got you, babe, da-da, da-da, da-da, I got you, babe…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Red Leader, I’m really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard and Bernadette (singing)
utterance.content: I got you, babe.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I missed you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? I missed you, too.

utterance.speaker: Very tall and powerfully built man
utterance.content: Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, my God, Glenn!

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Great to see you!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you here for the conference?

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m doing a global warming panel.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, good for you. Uh, Glenn, this is my boyfriend Howard.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Oh. Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi. Ow. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: You’re a lucky man. Bernie’s a great gal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. Bernie sure is.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Well, I got to run. The panel’s tomorrow morning. It’s called, Remembering Snow: A Look Back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ll try to catch it.

utterance.speaker: Glenn
utterance.content: Oh, great. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernie?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please tell me he’s your gay cousin.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. He was one of my professors in college.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh! That’s a relief.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Then we went out for a year. Come on, let’s check in, so we can take that nap.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: No, it’s not necessarily proportional. Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That green bag is Dr. Cooper’s. Here’s an extra five. Make him wait. Oh. Right to the nap, huh? Okay? Uh, so, this Glenn guy. You say you went out with him for, like, a year.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do we really need to talk about my old boyfriend now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. I guess not. What is he, like, six-four, six-five?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Six-seven.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Probably has a hard time finding a suit that fits.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is something bothering you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. It’s just…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m just thinking. If you had sex with that guy, I mean, there’s nothing I can do here that will make any kind of impact.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, it’s not a contest. I love you. I want to be with you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, great, love you, too, but, if it were a contest, I wouldn’t have a chance, right?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You can’t think that way.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep. Loser.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, stop it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. I just never figured that a guy like me going out with a girl like you would ever have to compete with a guy like that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait a minute, a girl like me? What’s that mean?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m… I…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you saying you don’t think I’m hot enough to go out with a guy like Glenn?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No! No, I’m saying exactly the opposite.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m too hot to go out with a guy like Glenn?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s go with that.

utterance.speaker: Amy (exiting bathroom)
utterance.content: Still nothing. Remind me to try again in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Will do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, girl talk?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, sure. What do you, what do you got in mind?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you subscribe to the Freudian theory of penis envy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I never really thought about it. Why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sometimes I think it might be nice to have one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not for sex, for convenience. You can’t deny that, by comparison, our internal plumbing is extremely high maintenance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Again, I’ve never given it much thought.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We have time now. Think about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny (knock on door)
utterance.content: Oh, good. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can I stay here tonight?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Why, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard’s a complete and total ass.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, that. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks. I’ll sleep on the floor.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not necessary. Penny and I are perfectly comfortable sharing a bed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We are?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course, we’re best friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, right, right, the blog.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Word of warning, though. I’m prone to night terrors, so if I wake up kicking and screaming, don’t panic. Just pin me down and stroke my hair, and I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, can I stay here tonight?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Shh-shh-shh-shh. Sheldon’s asleep. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, Howard’s a complete and total ass, Bernadette’s in my bed, and no matter how much you stroke Amy’s hair, she bites.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Never mind. Can I stay here or not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, how do you wanna do this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m not getting in bed with him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it is a little like getting into Dracula’s coffin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re just gonna have to make the best of this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, when you say make the best of it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sleep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. So we’ll just call the middle here the Neutral Zone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Star Trek. You know, the Neutral Zone between the Federation and the Romulan Empire.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Just like old times.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course, sometimes the Federation and the Romulans would enter the Neutral Zone to negotiate a temporary truce.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, let me put this in a way you’ll understand. From the waist down, my shields are up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it, got it. We can do all kinds of stuff from the waist up, you know?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please tell me you’re not having coitus.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We are not having coitus.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you guarantee that it won’t happen at any time during the night?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: TV Announcer
utterance.content: Next on Turner Classic Movies, Bridget Jones’s Diary.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, I’m crying already.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj? Raj? Raj? I need to sleep here tonight.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard is a complete and total ass, Bernadette is in Penny’s bed, Amy bites, and Penny may or may not have coitus with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, are you asleep?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I really appreciate you letting me stay here tonight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, no problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know it’s kinda weird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: True dat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: True dat?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve gotten a lot more street since we broke up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right. Still mad at me about that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. No, I understand. I got too intense, you had to back off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve gotten a lot better at that, you know. I’ve dated four different women since we broke up and I didn’t tell any of them that I loved them and wanted to have their babies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night. You know, maybe it wouldn’t be the worst idea in the world to violate the Neutral Zone for just one night. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, Sheldon kicked me out of the room, gave me your key.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny’s here. No, we don’t want to watch Bridget Jones’s Diary!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good morning and welcome to Science and Society. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, BS, MS, MA, PhD, and ScD. OMG, right? Perhaps that joke was a little too hippie-dippy for this crowd. All right then, we’ll begin with opening remarks. Miss Rostenkowski, would you like to start us off by discussing your assessment of science’s responsibility to society?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure. I think all branches of science have to move cautiously these days. It’s not just giant nuclear weapons that can destroy the world. As a microbiologist, I can tell you even the tiniest organisms can still tear you a new one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Interesting. I think what you might need to know about my colleague is that though she claims her field of interest is tiny organisms, she certainly has spent her fair share of time around what we can assume was pretty massive weaponry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think Mr. Wolowitz needs to keep in mind that the past is the past. But he should know that I am the kind of girl who could get all the giant missiles she wants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are we talking about women wanting penises? Because I’d like to weigh in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr. Koothrappali, would you care to join the conversation?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Certainly. I’d like to raise two points. Number one, I think they are talking about penises. And number two, these mimosas are kicking my little brown ass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d like to kick your little brown ass.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe when you walk into a hotel room and you see a guy getting back together with his girlfriend, you should consider doing something other than crawling into the adjoining bed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did. You said no Bridget Jones.

utterance.speaker: Penny (voice)
utterance.content: We weren’t getting back together! It was a one-time thing!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. We’re not taking comments or questions from the audience just yet.

utterance.speaker: Penny(voice)
utterance.content: Oh, shut up, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, bestie.

utterance.speaker: Penny(voice)
utterance.content: Yeah, hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, why don’t we see if we can bring this back to topic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me ask you something, Bernie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I guess not.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How would you feel if you met my ex-girlfriend and she was like Angelina Jolie?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Howard, be realistic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What, I’m not hot enough for Angelina Jolie?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to weigh in here. No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, why don’t we open it up to Q_A from the audience?

utterance.speaker: Penny (voice)
utterance.content: Yeah, I have a question. Is there anybody who can get me the hell out of here and back to Los Angeles tonight?

utterance.speaker: Glenn (voice)
utterance.content: I’m driving back to L.A. tonight.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Um, Penny, that’s Glenn. Glenn, that’s Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Red Leader to Red Five. Red Leader to Red Five. Anybody up for a little game? I spy with my little eye, a nonferrous metal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Must be out of range.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Leonard, can I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you bothered by the fact that your former girlfriend left the symposium with what is probably the most beautiful man I’ve ever seen in my life?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Why do you ask?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because we’re going 120 miles per hour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, if no one’s going to guess, I was spying the aluminium rims on the police car we passed a few miles back.
